job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Provide lots of education and will finance some of your education. Overall it's a great place to learn and acquire experience.
cons: Nursing growth is mostly if you want to become manager or lead. The actual extremely talented RNs on the floor are overlooked when we know a lot of nurses do not want to leave bedside. You have to build a portfolio there and attend extra classes and trainings, even volunteer your time for free to "get points" so you can qualify for a few cents raise through your portfolio. They don't have an actual level nursing development program that recognizes your worth on the floor. So no wonder bedside nursing is mostly travel nurses now in some units, so that Parkview can mantain their own employees at lower pay and uninterested on the floor.

cons: Other than some managers are too laissez-faire, which allows some employees to abuse the system knowing nothing will happen to them. There was a survey sent out by the director over the Labs at all the hospitals. The survey pretty much said we don't know why people are leaving but here is this survey to let us know if there is anything to address. But we will not address any issues unless we reach a certain level of responses (Sic). Also, at-will state means you sneezed, you're fired. Don't count on staying at the hospital too long unless you don't rub anyone the wrong way.

job_title: Patient Financial Resource in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: great health insurance, other company benefits are great (employee assistance program, my well being, etc)
cons: terrible pay unless you're clinical like a nurse or MA. extremely toxic environment. clinical staff treats non-clinical staff horribly. company had a terrible response to COVID. There was an outbreak in the building I worked in and they didn't make us aware/did not get time off to get tested. Coworker showed up to work despite making it clear she was having COVID symptoms and later got a positive test result. No reprimand was given for coming to work with obvious symptoms that she told others about. The point system for absences is awful. You get a point every time you call off/leave early. If you're a full time employee you only get 8 points a year or you're fired. HR is only there to protect the company image, not actual coworkers, even when there is serious offenses happening.

job_title: Billing Specialist in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: There are opportunities to increase education including pursuing a college degree with tuition assistance. For the most part there is a good culture in the work place- respect, courtesy, etc. I have heard of some discrimination but it's usually dealt with internally and quietly. There is a committee to promote awareness that is making strides in the right direction.
cons: Required overtime (10-20 hrs per week), lack of room for advancement within teams (can't advance to a trainer without the current trainer leaving), time off is seniority based, no unpaid holidays, no sick leave bank, high employee insurance rates (Signature Care) with high deductible

review_title: Forbes Got It Wrong....If Parkview is one of the best,,,I hate to see the worst.
job_title: Nutrition Assistant in Columbia City, IN
pros: Hourly wage is higher than most places though it should be higher due to the cost of living. They will invest in your education and pay for it 100 percent and in any field that you like. It does not have to be in the healthcare field.
cons: 9  to 10 hour shifts. Working 7 days straight without a day off. Lack of teamwork or tolerance of others lifestyle or beliefs. Lack of work life balance and working at a hospital you are more likely to get sick however they do not care. Even with a doctors note your illness will not be excused and will go against you. Poor training and favoritism is wide spread as well and again compared to other employers like Ikea and Costco and Target we are paid too low for the job that is expected of us. We should be making 16 to 18 an hour with what is expected of us.

review_title: Not much changes in the Midwest, except the "brochure-ware"
job_title: BSA in Fort Wayne, IN
pros:
Location.  Fort Wayne is a great place to raise a family.  The schools are marvelous.  Parkview is a respected employer and Parkview Employees automatically enjoy better credit-trust with local business because of this.

The work load is not heavy and the career advantage from working at Parkview is a little above average.  Parkview is a good place to park while you are raising a family.  But to build a good career one has to look elsewhere.
cons:
The work load and projects is not enought to build a good career.  Parkview is a good place to park while you are raising a family.  But to build a good career one has to look elsewhere.  I did and more than doubled my income working on career building and challenging projects.
I was sad to Leave Fort Wayne but happy to move on.

job_title: Patient Access in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Parkview is a wonderful company that definitely helps you out when you are financially broke. When COVID hit, the employee assistance fund helped with my bills and grocery. I’m forever grateful. My coworkers in my own department are like family as well.
cons: However depending on your title, if you are lower, don’t bother someone learning your name or treat you the same. Been there for almost two years and learned the clinical staff’s name. However because I was non clinical, they barely knew mine. Respect goes all around regardless of your position.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Parkview is a friendly, open environment. If you're looking to get involved with committees or education, then you will find those opportunities here.  There is a core group of determined, dedicated nurses who work hard and do some wonderful things to promote quality care and evidence based practice.
cons: The pay and staffing ratios, while comparable with other hospitals in Fort Wayne, are not competitive. 4:1 ratios are found in step down and oncology areas with med-surg floors seeing 5 and 6:1. Efficiency of care and "customer service" are valued more than quality care.  Pay starts at 19.75 for RNs. Yep, it's that low. Most nurses I know, even charge nurses, make less than 25/hr.

job_title: Interface Integration Analyst II in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: The salary is decent for the area I live in.  The company has really good health insurance.  Company also offers retirement benefits and match's donations into an account.   Company is Not For Profit so there are no shareholders to please.  Management gets bonuses.
cons: There is no longer a daycare center.  Teams are always understaffed.  It is hard to find employees that are willing to relocate.  Many people leave the company for more money.  IT department supports too many locations in a very wide area of the state.  Could use more people.  Lots of stress due to being short staffed.

review_title: I loved working at Parkview!  I always wanted to work at Parkview and when I finally got in I was so ecstatic!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: The best things about working for Parkview are:  My manager, the pay, the incentive contracts, 3-3 shift, nurse to patient ratio, and self scheduling!  Also requesting off was no problem at all!  The floor I was working on was amazing, my coworkers were more than helpful, the self scheduling was awesome, and I had the perfect shift!  Not to mention I came from a competing hospital and immediately started out making more hourly just to start than I had been making in over a year at the other hospital!
cons: I have nothing bad to say about working at Parkview. The only con was that my husband got a job transfer and we ended up moving!

job_title: Porter in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: More than enough time on the clock was available
cons: They allowed employees that have worked there for several years to walk around a do nothing for several hours at a time with out any repercussions. They expected the new hires to pick up any and all slack that the other individuals would leave behind. Which in turn would add to the work load that I would have to do. When I went to management about this they not only did nothing to fix the situation but they informed the employee who it was that informed them of the situation in the first place. Which in turn created a hostile work environment.  There is a lot more I could add to this section.

review_title: Neat job but it's still the midwest where you wont make it or what is required
job_title: Patient Access Services Representative in Fort Wayne, IN
pros:
*Starting position to enter the Administration sector of the machine
*Easy to get advancements or change to new deapartments
*Decent benefits
cons:
*High turnover rate
*Strict attendance policy even if you are sick with doctors note
*Never understood how a hospital would rather you be sick and work when you affect the patients coming and going
*No matter how many years you work in the roll you wont advance past 13/hour 
*Bottom of the totem poll position. You feel it.
*Constant changes and new policies added. May be small but it all adds up. For what you are paid, not worth it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: I met some pretty awesome people over the years. Some of them even became very close friends. I will never regret the experience but I am glad I no longer work there.
cons: My biggest issue was with the upper level management. They were always changing policies and procedures without consulting the people who worked in the area. Some things were beneficial but others were pointless and not needed. Management had never worked this position and had no way of knowing if the change was needed or not.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Lots of jobs always available. Unfortunately they keep increasing the requirements to be eligible for transfer and those requirements are not explained to you prior to accepting a position. They continually repeat the opportunities Parkview provides but make it incredibly difficult to take advantage of those "opportunities".
cons: HR is very misleading on benefits. They purposely omit that all holidays when the departments are closed (approx. 8 days a year) you are required to use your own PTO for.  Yearly raises are minimal and they constantly change the criteria for said raises, resulting in months of delays in actually receiving them. 2 chances for a company wide 1k bonus each year but rarely ever happens. Very few coworkers (outside of RN and other clinical positions) actually end up doing the work described in their job description.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Each division of the hospital falls under a separate "command team" therefore decision making happens in a timely manner. There is a lot of support from management above you to excel and grow.
cons: Working within the clinics and dealing with all matters can be frustrating when you need to reach out to different departments to assist in getting a task done...i.e. inventory & supply, advertising info, pamphlets and such. This is not so much a con though, as you are given all the information needed to make sure you reach out to the right team.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Pay, benefits,  PTO.  Time in a half on holidays, potential to get overtime.  Advancement opportunities.  Talking to paitents and their families
cons: Employees hiding, sleeping, not doing their work. Always recommends friends who become lazy too. Anytime issues come up it seems to never get delt with by the supervisors.  Watch who you tell something to because everyone on your shift will know. Thought supervisors are suppose to keep things confidential. Can not trust anyone. That's pretty sad.

review_title: Excellent Organization That Just Needs a Few Tweaks
job_title: Director in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Very good CEO leadership--I hope he stays for another 10 years.  Lots of financial strength, which is needed in health care if you want a stable work environment.  By far the dominant provider in its region, although there is a significant for-profit competitor, Lutheran Health.  Has invested in a new legacy facility that should last 50-75 years, invested in a large, growing medical group and in a great IT system, EPIC.
cons:
Benefits are average to slightly below average for the area, but the health plan sucks.  It used to be the best health plan in town, but due to the inability of their staff to manage utilization and cost trends, they have merely shifted the costs to employees by reducing benefits.  It is totally avoidable and could be turned around in a year with good management.

Parkview's greatest opportunity and greatest risk is its employed physician group.  The group lacks a culture and common set of values and is a medical group only in structure.  Much of the fault lies with the current physician leadership at Parkview, from the chief medical officer on down.  They lack vision and the ability to act strategically.  Getting a handle on this issue is the key to the organization's future success.

Parkview is rife with silos.  It allow weak managers to exist and appear successful.  The senior leadership team is largely better than average, but many of the middle managers are weak.  Parkview doesn't do a good job of providing continuing education to employees, especially in terms of management skills.  It also tends to hire almost entirely from within or from the immediate area.  Management could definitely use some new blood.  My last manager was so AWOL from the job that they spent only 10 minutes face-to-face with me in the 18 months I spent in the position and ghost-wrote my performance review without any involvement with me!

job_title: Applications Analyst in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Lots of good people to work with. They are true to their Mission and Values, and are accommodating to staff in times of need.
cons: Pay is well below the Market, Long term employees are paid lower than incoming new hires. Management in constant back and forth about fair pay.

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: You will learn to deal with very bad management.
cons: Floor staff do not feel valued or respected. Management demands we provide excellent care to our patients (which is a good thing) but don't give us the resources or autonomy to do so. The relationship between staff and management in the building I work in is very poor. staff morale is low, staff dissatisfaction is high. The demands on the floor staff are sometimes unrealistic and borderline dangerous. Nurses are given up to 15 patients each at times and forced to work up to 16 hours in a row.

review_title: Great place to work and positively affect the lives of others.

review_title: Nice hospital but I feel underpaid for the work I do.

review_title: I'm proud to be a health care provider here

large organization

review_title: For the area, best hospital to work for.
